comments:
I20040129

1. install fresh I20040129
2. start old workspace using above install
3. exit
Note: could repeat steps 2 and 3 here n-times without problems
4. unzip a zip which contains the newest code for our plug-ins (plug-in export)
   over above installation. They are all unzipped under   
   <installDir>\eclipse\plugins
   Nothing is written into config area.
5. start the workspace again.
==> does not start, error in .log (see below)

This is pretty severe as we've always supported this in the past and have not
advertised a new way of triggering reconciling of the plugins directory.
I believe this is an outstanding update problem.  Moving.

The problem is caused by osgi caching the bundles and not invalidate the cache 
when the bundles have changed on the disk.
The fix is in the gray area between the osgi runtime and the update 
configurator and we are investigating it.

This looks like a dup of bug 50860 which was fixed today

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50860 ***
Will this go into todays EclipseCon integration builds?
No, only in the nightly build.
Which plug-in do I need from the N-build?
Thanks, I'll give it a try.

Still there in I20040203 - bug 50860 is still open and is in SWT - is this the
correct bug?
wrong dup: it should be 50680 not 50860

Bug is fixed, and it should be available in the next integration build (the 
project was versioned and released today, 2004/02/03). Currently the fix is 
only in the nightly builds.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50680 ***
